Most often you will deal with Drawer as the type of resource retrieved for drawing things to the screen; the Drawer class provides a generic API for dealing with an underlying visual resource that may take a variety of forms. Detailed Description

A Drawer is a general abstraction for "an object used to draw something." Most often you will deal with Drawer as the type of resource retrieved for drawing things to the screen; the Drawer class provides a generic API for dealing with an underlying visual resource that may take a variety of forms.

A Drawer does not have any facility to receive events or otherwise interact with the user.

In addition to simple drawing, Drawer provides a number of generic mechanisms for its client to interact with what to draw:

  • The setBounds method must be called to tell the Drawer where it should draw and how large it should be. All Drawers should respect the requested size, often simply by scaling their imagery. A client can find the preferred size for some Drawers with the getIntrinsicHeight and getIntrinsicWidth methods.

  • The getPadding method can return from some Drawers information about how to frame content that is placed inside of them. For example, a Drawer that is intended to be the frame for a button widget would need to return padding that correctly places the label inside of itself.

  • The setState method allows the client to tell the Drawer which state it should draw, such as "focused", "selected", etc. Some Drawers may modify their imagery based on the selected state.

  • The setLevel method allows the client to supply a single continuous controller that can modify the Drawer is displayed, such as a battery level or progress level. Some drawers may modify their imagery based on the current level.

Though usually not visible to the application, Drawers may take a variety of forms:

  • Bitmap: the simplest Drawer, a PNG or JPEG image.
  • NinePatch: an extension to the PNG format allows it to specify information about how to stretch it and place things inside of it.
  • Layers: a compound drawer, which draws multiple underlying drawers on top of each other.
  • States: a compound drawer that selects one of a set of drawers based on its state.
  • Levels: a compound drawer that selects one of a set of drawers based on its level.

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::graphics::Drawer::clearColorFilter ( )

clean drawer's color filter.

void gaia::graphics::Drawer::copyBounds ( Rect *  bounds) const

Return a copy of the drawer's bounds in the specified Rect (allocated by the caller).

The bounds specify where this will draw when its draw() method is called.

Parameters:
boundsRect to receive the drawer's bounds (allocated by the caller).
Rect gaia::graphics::Drawer::copyBounds ( ) const

Return a copy of the drawer's bounds in a new Rect.

This returns the same values as getBounds(), but the returned object is guaranteed to not be changed later by the drawer (i.e. it retains no reference to this rect). If the caller already has a Rect allocated, call #copyBounds(Rect*).

virtual void gaia::graphics::Drawer::draw ( Canvas *  canvas) [pure virtual]

Draw in its bounds (set via setBounds) respecting optional effects such as alpha (set via setAlpha) and color filter (set via setColorFilter).

Parameters:
canvasThe canvas to draw into

Implemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::ColorDrawer, gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawerPlus, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

Rect gaia::graphics::Drawer::getBounds ( ) const

Return the drawer's bounds Rect.

Note: for efficiency, the returned object may be the same object stored in the drawer (though this is not guaranteed), so if a persistent copy of the bounds is needed, call copyBounds(rect) instead. You should also not change the object returned by this method as it may be the same object stored in the drawer.

Returns:
The bounds of the drawer (which may change later, so caller beware). DO NOT ALTER the returned object as it may change the stored bounds of this drawer.
Drawer* gaia::graphics::Drawer::getCurrentN ( ) const
Returns:
The current drawer that will be used by this drawer. For simple drawers, this is just the drawer itself. For drawers that change state like StateListDrawer and LevelListDrawer this will be the child drawable currently in use.
virtual int32_t gaia::graphics::Drawer::getIntrinsicHeight ( ) const [virtual]

Return the intrinsic height of the underlying Drawer object.

Returns -1 if it has no intrinsic height, such as with a solid color.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

Return the intrinsic width of the underlying Drawer object.

Returns -1 if it has no intrinsic width, such as with a solid color.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

int32_t gaia::graphics::Drawer::getLevel ( ) const

Retrieve the current level.

Returns:
int32_t Current level, from 0 (minimum) to 10000 (maximum).
virtual int32_t gaia::graphics::Drawer::getMinimumHeight ( ) const [virtual]

Returns the minimum height suggested by this Drawer.

If a View uses this Drawer as a background, it is suggested that the Widget use at least this value for its height. (There will be some scenarios where this will not be possible.) This value should INCLUDE any padding.

Returns:
The minimum height suggested by this Drawer. If this Drawer doesn't have a suggested minimum height, 0 is returned.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

virtual int32_t gaia::graphics::Drawer::getMinimumWidth ( ) const [virtual]

Returns the minimum width suggested by this Drawer.

If a View uses this Drawer as a background, it is suggested that the Widget use at least this value for its width. (There will be some scenarios where this will not be possible.) This value should INCLUDE any padding.

Returns:
The minimum width suggested by this Drawer. If this Drawer doesn't have a suggested minimum width, 0 is returned.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

virtual int32_t gaia::graphics::Drawer::getOpacity ( ) const [pure virtual]

Return the opacity/transparency of this Drawer.

Generally a Drawer should be as conservative as possible with the value it returns. For example, if it contains multiple child drawers and only shows one of them at a time.

Note that the returned value does not take into account a custom alpha that has been applied by the client through the setAlpha methods.

Returns:
int32_t The opacity class of the Drawer.

Implemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::ColorDrawer, gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer, and gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer.

virtual bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::getPadding ( Rect *  padding) const [virtual]

Return in padding the insets suggested by this Drawer for placing content inside the drawer's bounds.

Positive values move toward the center of the Drawer (set Rect::inset). Returns true if this drawer actually has a padding, else false. When false is returned, the padding is always set to 0.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

const gaia::base::Array<int32_t> gaia::graphics::Drawer::getState ( )

Describes the current state, as a union of primitve states, such as state_focused, state_selected, etc.

Some drawers may modify their imagery based on the selected state.

Returns:
An array of resource Ids describing the current state.

virtual bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::isStateful ( ) const [virtual]

Indicates whether this widget will change its appearance based on state.

Clients can use this to determine whether it is necessary to calculate their state and call setState.

Returns:
True if this widget changes its appearance based on state, false otherwise.
See also:
setState(const gaia::base::Array<int32_t>&)

bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::isVisible ( ) const

Get whether this Drawer is visible.

Drawer* gaia::graphics::Drawer::mutate ( )

Make this drawer mutable.

This operation cannot be reversed. A mutable drawer is guaranteed to not share its state with any other drawer. This is especially useful when you need to modify properties of drawers loaded from resources. By default, all drawers instances loaded from the same resource share a common state; if you modify the state of one instance, all the other instances will receive the same modification. Calling this method on a mutable Drawer will have no effect.

virtual bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::onLevelChange ( int32_t  level) [virtual]

OOverride this in your subclass to change appearance if you vary based on level.

Returns:
Returns true if the level change has caused the appearance of the Drawer to change (that is, it needs to be drawn), else false if it looks the same and there is no need to redraw it since its last level.
virtual bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::onStateChange ( const gaia::base::Array< int32_t > &  state) [virtual]

Override this in your subclass to change appearance if you recognize the specified state.

Returns:
Returns true if the state change has caused the appearance of the Drawer to change (that is, it needs to be drawn), else false if it looks the same and there is no need to redraw it since its last state.
virtual void gaia::graphics::Drawer::setAlpha ( int32_t  alpha) [pure virtual]

Specify an alpha value for the drawer.

0 means fully transparent, and 255 means fully opaque.

Implemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::ColorDrawer, gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

virtual void gaia::graphics::Drawer::setColorFilter ( const ColorFilter *  cf) [pure virtual]

Specify an optional colorFilter for the drawer.

Pass null to remove any filters.

Implemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, gaia::graphics::ColorDrawer, gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer, gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer, and gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawerPlus.

PorterDuff::Mode  mode 
)

Specify a color and porterduff mode to be the colorfilter for this drawer.

virtual void gaia::graphics::Drawer::setDither ( bool  dither) [virtual]

Set to true to have the drawer dither its colors when drawn to a device with fewer than 8-bits per color component.

This can improve the look on those devices, but can also slow down the drawing a little.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::GradientDrawer, gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer, and gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer.

virtual void gaia::graphics::Drawer::setFilterBitmap ( bool  filter) [virtual]

Set to true to have the drawer filter its bitmap when scaled or rotated (for drawers that use bitmaps).

If the drawer does not use bitmaps, this call is ignored. This can improve the look when scaled or rotated, but also slows down the drawing.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::BitmapDrawer, and gaia::graphics::NinePatchDrawer.

bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::setLevel ( int32_t  level)

Specify the level for the drawer.

This allows a drawer to vary its imagery based on a continuous controller, for example to show progress or volume level.

Parameters:
levelThe new level, from 0 (minimum) to 10000 (maximum).
Returns:
Returns true if this change in level has caused the appearance of the Drawer to change (hence requiring an invalidate), otherwise returns false.
bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::setState ( const gaia::base::Array< int32_t > &  stateSet)

Specify a set of states for the drawer.

Parameters:
stateSetThe new set of states to be displayed.
Returns:
Returns true if this change in state has caused the appearance of the Drawer to change (hence requiring an invalidate), otherwise returns false.
virtual bool gaia::graphics::Drawer::setVisible ( bool  visible,
bool  restart 
) [virtual]

Set whether this Drawer is visible.

This generally does not impact the Drawer's behavior, but is a hint that can be used by some Drawers, for example, to decide whether run animations.

Parameters:
visibleSet to true if visible, false if not.
restartYou can supply true here to force the drawer to behave as if it has just become visible, even if it had last been set visible. Used for example to force animations to restart.
Returns:
boolean Returns true if the new visibility is different than its previous state.

Reimplemented in gaia::graphics::LayerDrawer, gaia::graphics::AnimationDrawer, gaia::graphics::DrawerContainer, and gaia::graphics::RotateDrawer.
